title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8193-4.4 - Content of the assessor's report
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8193-4.4 - Content of the assessor's report

State Regulations
(a) Each part of the assessor's report shall
provide: (1)
the name or SWIS code of the
assessing unit, or of the city, town or village for which a county assesses, or
of the borough of the City of New York for which the report is being
prepared; (2)
the name of the
county in which the assessing unit is located; and
(3)
the year of the current roll. (b) In addition to the
requirements of subdivision (a) of this section, Part 1 of the assessor's
report shall, as a minimum, provide: (1)
the
number of parcels in roll sections 1 and 6 on the current assessment
roll; (2)
a statement of whether
the current assessment roll contains parcels which have been converted to
nonagricultural use and which previously received an agricultural exemption
pursuant to section 305 of the Agricultural and Markets Law for an assessment
roll prepared no more than five years earlier or pursuant to section
306
of the Agriculture and Markets Law for
an assessment roll prepared no more than eight years earlier; (3)
a statement of whether the assessing unit
has imposed penalty taxes on a parcel or parcels converted to nonagricultural
use which had previously received an agricultural exemption pursuant to section
305 or 306 of the Agricultural and Markets Law; (4)
for both the prior roll and current roll, summaries of: (i) the total assessed value of
roll section 1 properties; (ii)
the
total assessed value of roll section 3 properties; (iii)
the total assessed value of roll
section 6 properties; (iv)
the
total assessed value of all roll section 1, 3 and 6 properties; (v) the initial assessments of all roll
section 1, 3 and 6 properties; (5)
for a special assessing unit, for the
current roll, summaries of: (i) the total
assessed value of roll section 5 properties in each real property class within
the special assessing unit; (ii)
the total assessed value of roll section 5 properties in each real property
class within each portion; (iii)
for a special assessing unit which is a city, the total assessed value of roll
section 5 properties within each borough; (6)
for a homestead assessing unit, for both
the prior roll and the current roll, summaries of: (i) the total assessed value of all locally
assessed properties in the homestead class; (ii)
the total assessed value of all locally
assessed properties in the nonhomestead class; (7)
for a city or town located in more than
one school district, for both the prior roll and the current roll, summaries as
identified by school district code of: (i) the total assessed value of roll section 1 properties; (ii)
the total assessed value of roll section
3 properties; (iii)
the total
assessed value of roll section 6 properties; (iv)
the total assessed value of all roll
section 1, 3 and 6 properties; (v) the initial assessments of all roll section 1, 3 and 6 properties; (8)
for all assessing units, for
both the prior roll and the current roll, the total assessed value of
residential property; (9)
for a
town containing part or all of one or more villages, the total assessed value
on the town roll of all roll section 1 and 6 properties for each village or
part thereof; (10)
for a town
homestead assessing unit which contains all or part of a village, for both the
prior roll and current roll, summaries as identified by village SWIS code and
town outside village SWIS code of: (i) the
total assessed value of all roll section 1 and 6 properties in the homestead
class; and
(ii)
the total assessed
value of all roll section 1 and 6 properties in the nonhomestead
class; (11)
for a city
or town homestead assessing unit located in more than one school district, for
both the prior roll and current roll, summaries as identified by school
district code of: (i) the total assessed
value of all roll section 1 and 6 properties in the homestead class; and
(ii)
the total assessed value
of all roll section 1 and 6 properties in the nonhomestead class; (12)
for a special assessing unit
which contains all or part of a village, for both the prior roll and current
roll, summaries as identified by village SWIS code and town outside village
SWIS code of the total assessed value of all roll section 1 and 6 properties in
each real property class; (13)
for
a special assessing unit located in more than one school district, for both the
prior roll and current roll, summaries as identified by school district code of
the total assessed value of all roll section 1 and 6 properties in each real
property class; (14)
for a city
assessing unit to which the Multiple Dwelling Law is applicable and the
assessor has requested a certified change in level of assessment pursuant to

Subpart 8186-3 of this Title for properties receiving an exemption pursuant to
section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law, summaries
of the total assessed value of locally assessed properties receiving an
exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law; (15)
the name, address and telephone number
of the sole assessor or each member of the board of assessors; and
(16)
a signed and dated written statement "I
(We) hereby certify that the information contained in Parts 1 and 2 of this
report constitutes a true statement of fact."
(c) In addition to the requirements of
subdivision (a) of this section, Part 2 of the assessor's report shall, as a
minimum, provide: (1)

In each assessing unit, a detailed list of each parcel in roll sections 1, 3 and 6 and, in a special
assessing unit, a detailed list of each part of a parcel bisected by a school
district or village boundary line, and in a homestead assessing unit, a
detailed list of each homestead or nonhomestead part of a parcel split between
the homestead and nonhomestead class, which from the prior roll to the current
roll: (i) increased or decreased in total
assessed value; (ii)
changed roll
section; (iii)
changed school
district; (iv)
for a special
assessing unit, changed real property class; (v) for other than a special assessing unit, changed from nonresidential property to residential property or from
residential property to nonresidential property; (vi)
for a homestead assessing unit changed
from the homestead class to the nonhome- stead class or from the nonhomestead
class to the homestead class; (vii)
for a special assessing unit or homestead assessing unit, changed village or
town- outside-village location; (viii)
for a special assessing unit, changed
from a parcel subject to an assessment limitation to a parcel not subject to an
assessment limitation or changed from a parcel not subject to an assessment
limitation to a parcel subject to an assessment limitation; or
(ix)
for a city assessing unit to which the

Multiple Dwelling Law is applicable and the assessor has requested a certified
change in level of assessment pursuant to Subpart 8186-3 of this Title for
properties receiving an exemption pursuant to section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law changed
from a parcel receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law to a parcel
not receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law or changed
from a parcel not receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law to a parcel
receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law; (2)
the following data items shall
be included for each parcel or part of a parcel described in paragraph (4) of
this subdivision: (i) parcel identification, including SWIS code; (ii)
split-merge number, if any; (iii)
from the prior roll: (a) the property
classification code including the ownership code; (b) roll section; (c) school district code; (d) total assessed value; (e) for special assessing units, the real
property class; (f) for special
assessing units and approved assessing units, the initial assessment; (g) for homestead assessing units, an
indicator for each parcel or part of a parcel in the homestead class; (h) for special assessing units, an indicator
for each parcel subject to an assessment limitation; (i) for a city assessing unit to which the

Multiple Dwelling Law is applicable and the assessor has requested a certified
change in level of assessment pursuant to Subpart 8186-3 of this Title for
properties receiving an exemption pursuant to section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law, the
property tax exemption code for each parcel receiving an exemption as provided
in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law; (iv)
from the current roll: (a) the property classification code
including the ownership code; (b) roll section; (c) school district
code; (d) total assessed
value; (e) for special assessing
units, the real property class; (f) for special assessing units and approved assessing units, the initial
assessment; (g) for homestead
assessing units, a designation for each parcel or part of a parcel in the
homestead class; (h) for special
assessing units, an indicator for each parcel subject to an assessment
limitation; (i) for a city
assessing unit to which the Multiple Dwelling Law is applicable and the
assessor has requested a certified change in level of assessment pursuant to

Subpart 8186-3 of this Title for properties receiving an exemption pursuant to
section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law, the
property tax exemption code for each parcel receiving an exemption as provided
in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law; (v) the amount of increase for
physical or quantity changes, if any; (vi)
the amount of increase for equalization, if any; (vii)
the amount of
decrease for physical or quantity changes, if any; and
(viii)
the amount of decrease for
equalization if any. (d) In addition to the requirements of
subdivision (a) of this section, Part 6 of the assessor's report shall, as a
minimum, provide: (1)
for each parcel where a
court, other than a small claims court, has ordered a reduction in total
assessed value, changed the taxable status of the parcel so that it is no
longer considered a locally assessed property, or for a special assessing unit, changed the real property class, or for a homestead assessing unit, changed
from the homestead class to the nonhomestead class or from the nonhomestead
class to the homestead class, or in the case of a city assessing unit to which
the Multiple Dwelling Law is applicable and the assessor has requested a
certified change in level of assessment pursuant to Subpart 8186-3 of this

Title for properties receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law changed
from a parcel receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law to a parcel
not receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law or changed
from a parcel not receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law to a parcel
receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law, the
following information: (i) parcel
identification; (ii)
school
district; (iii)
for each assessment
roll affected by the court order: (a) the
assessment roll year; (b) the total
assessed value before and after the court order; (c) roll section before and after the court
order; (d) property classification
code including ownership code before and after the court order; (e) for special assessing units, real
property class before and after the court order; (f) for special assessing units and approved
assessing units, the initial assessment before and after the court
order; (g) for homestead assessing
units, a designation for each parcel or part of a parcel in the homestead class
before and after the court order; and
(h) for a city assessing unit to which the

Multiple Dwelling Law is applicable and the assessor has requested a certified
change in level of assessment pursuant to Subpart 8186-3 of this Title for
properties receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law the
exemption code for each parcel receiving an exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law before and
after the court order; and
(2)
a signed and dated statement: "I (We)
certify that the information contained in Part 6 of this report constitutes a
true statement of fact."
(e) In addition to the requirements of
subdivision (a) of this section, Part 7 of the assessor's report shall, as a
minimum, provide: (1)
for each parcel where a
correction of errors procedure, as described in title 3 of article 5 of the

Real Property Tax Law, or a small claims court proceeding has corrected or
changed the total assessed value, the initial assessment, roll section, school
district, real property class designation, homestead designation, or, in the
case of a city assessing unit to which the Multiple Dwelling Law is applicable
and for which the assessor has requested a certified change in level of
assessment pursuant to Subpart 8186-3 of this Title for properties receiving an
exemption as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law, its
exemption status as provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law, since the
last filing of Parts 1 and 2 of the assessor's report, the following items: (i) parcel identification; (ii)
school district code before and after
the correction or change; (iii)
property classification code including ownership code before and after the
correction or change; (iv)
roll
section before and after the correction or change; (v) a statement as to whether the parcel was
reported on Part 2 of the assessor's report last filed; (vi)
the total assessed value before and
after the correction or change; (vii)
the amount of increase for equalization
or decrease for equalization in total assessed value as a result of the
correction or change; (viii)
an
explanation of the correction or change; (ix)
for special assessing units, the real
property class before and after the correction or change; (x) for special assessing units and approved
assessing units, the initial assessment before and after the correction or
change; (xi)
for a homestead
assessing unit, the homestead designation before and after the correction or
change; and
(xii)
for a city
assessing unit to which the Multiple Dwelling Law is applicable and for which
the assessor has requested a certified change in level of assessment pursuant
to Subpart 8186-3 of this Title for properties receiving an exemption as
provided in section
489
of the Real Property Tax Law, the
exemption code before and after the correction or change; (2)
a signed and dated statement: "I (We)
certify that the above changes were ordered by the Board of Assessment Review
or Small Claims Court and that the changes so ordered were made to the final
assessment roll."
Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8193-4.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
